reviews.text: Stayed at Cannery Row Inn for 3 nights. Given the price and some reviews we were pleasantly surprised. The room was very clean and comfortable, fireplace, comfortable big bed and fridge in room (empty) and ice maker in the hall. Location excellent and a busy spot. First impression was noisy, but we didn't find this a problem at all. Had breakfast every morning which was decent quality and variety. I would recommend it to friends and stay here again given the price. Free parking was also a big bonus. Bearing in mind that this is an Inn and not hotel I thought it was good value for the area. I didn't expect luxury, and didn't get luxury, but got more than i thought i would.
reviews.title: Would recommend and stay again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for four days, because of its great location. The hotel is just near the Cannery Row close to Fisherman Wharp. Our room faced Lighthouse Avenue, a busy arterial street. It was kind of distructive.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Our room had a fireplace, high ceiling, and soft bed. Breakfast menu was limited to your typical bread and muffins continental style. No hot dishes like eggs or sausages. But the hotel offers the free parking!
reviews.title: Great Stay/ Good Location
Ugly. But a convenient location.
reviews.text: We just checked in at this hotel as we speak.Great location my buddy booked the room for one night great service the moment we arrived gal at the front desk really nice and got the best sense of humor!Our room has private balcony free wine breakfast and parking.Will be back!
Stayed 1 night. Got there from the AAA book.
reviews.title: Noisy rooms., paper thin walls. You can hear your neighbors and traffic. Room
Spacious and clean but not luxurious
reviews.text: This hotel has a good combination of price and location. Any other good accommodation in the same area will be much more expensive.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night. The room was ok. Nothing special, but nothing bad to say either. It was clean.
reviews.title: Reservation

reviews.text: The hotel looks a bit old (but so does every other building in the town) and the staff seemed easily annoyed.
reviews.title: Not Horrible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But when it comes down to its purpose (for us): a room to spend a night, do some sightseeing, and leave; it's more than enough.
reviews.title: Solid 2 1/2 Star

reviews.text: The place is withing walking distance from cannery row and the Monterrey bay aquarium, which I think is one of the most spectacular things I have seen for a while.
reviews.title: Good price Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great for parking and in a good location for Cannery Row and Fishermans warf.
reviews.title: Convenient location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The receptionist upgraded us to a room with a view. I think that any other room would have been a little depressing
reviews.title: Good Location/Friendly Staff

reviews.text: The room was large with vaulted ceiling and balcony with sea view (216). The common areas look tired and grubby.
reviews.title: Too nice for a stopover.

reviews.text: Breakfast is very basic buffet but it was a little treat to take it up to our room and eat on the balcony.
reviews.title: Nice Stayed

reviews.text: I would agree that it seems that all receptionists are as helpful as others. One was glued to the computer screen and not attentative to guests to the point we felt we were interupting her
reviews.title: paying for convenience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found this place on Cannery Row, and were pleasantly surprised. Our $99 room was very large, and on the second floor has a vaulted ceiling. Our room has a gas fireplace and the bed is comfortable. When we asked to spend a second night they told us the the room rate had doubled for "the weekend rate", but it was a Thursday, so we went online and found the room for $117 and they honored that rate, so all is good ! Shop the internet for rates and stay here, it's very nice. Parking lot is well lit and secure too...
reviews.title: Not perfect, but they really try !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I agreed with Thomas V front desk guy had an attitude!.. morning gal was really friendly and helpful. Parking is free room is clean we got our own private balcony free breakfast.Big plus you can leave your car all day once you check out.
reviews.title: Stayed here good location

reviews.text: Wow.. This was a crappy experience. The guy checking us in had the worst attitude, even my 13 year old niece noticed. He seemed to be disturbed we tried to check in early (1:30 pm). I said "no problem", this is our first time in Monterey, what do you recommend? He gives me a map and a flyer for a noodle house, (that closed at 2:00?) This guy is a complete jerk. I actually stopped in at another hotel (Monterey Plaza) for some help getting around town. They were so helpful. I can not believe the difference. They told us about Aquarium and the Fisherman's Wharf.
reviews.title: Spend your money elsewhere..

reviews.text: Room was so~so. After checking in around 4 pm, he could not get us rooms next to each other. There were so many loud, obnoxious guests at this hotel. Even while getting our breakfast (included with room), the two behind counter are sharing stories of the "annoying, drunk" guests and how they locked themselves out of there room.. Stay somewhere else..
reviews.title: Moderate hotel

reviews.text: We were in Monterey for a destination wedding. The hotel was very close to the wedding location and we were able to get our room at a reduced rate, that is why we chose this hotel. Free parking is definitely a plus, but with our large conversion van, the spaces were pretty tight. We parked the van and never moved it again until it was time to leave. The location in Cannery Row allows you to walk anywhere, but it's also on a main street, so we had traffic noises well into the night. The beds were newer and very comfortable with higher end linens. Breakfasts were advertised to begin at 7AM which consisted of coffee. The better breakfast offerings like waffles were not available until after 8 AM. My biggest compalint was the weather which has nothing to do with the hotel. It was cold and foggy each day were were there at the end of June, not what I would expect for a California coastal town in early summer.
reviews.title: Great location, that's it
